description:
Arajin Tomoshibi's reunion with his old pal Matakara Asamine takes an unexpected turn when they stumble into a brawl with the toughest guys in town. And just when you thought things couldn't get weirder, a colossal genie decides to drop in. Brace yourself for the ultimate showdown. It's the clash of the cool and the magical!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

Hiroko Utsumi is a Japanese director and animator.

Utsumi is best known for her work with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/), particularly as the original director of [Free!](https://anilist.co/anime/18507/), and for her later work at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/), where she directed [Banana Fish](https://anilist.co/anime/100388/). She is a graduate of the Osaka Municipal College of Design.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jetikariya50)

Acknowledged internationally for his work on [Yu☆Gi☆Oh!](https://anilist.co/anime/481/) and [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/).

Famous for his depictions of fingers and the "Joey Chin" in Yu-Gi-Oh!.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sg550_sig)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzukikbg)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kiminori114514) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/66126678)
__Tomoki Nagasaka__ is a Japanese editor who works for post production studio Jay Film.

[Website](http://www.michiru-oshima.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/OshimaMichiru) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/6zqZlqpjrq3op255dF32Fr?autoplay=true)

She is a composer who has worked on several video game, movie, and television titles. Her works include composition for the video games Ico for PlayStation 2, Arc the Lad III, and an orchestral arrangement of a Zelda medley for the Wii and Gamecube game The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess. In addition to video game music, she has composed music for the Godzilla movies and scores for numerous anime television series, including Fullmetal Alchemist (and the motion picure Fullmetal Alchemist the Movie: Conqueror of Shamballa), Queen Emeraldas and Bounen no Xamdou. She was also the composer for a Japanese stage musical adaptation of the classic Hollywood film Roman Holiday.

Ooshima graduated from the Kunitachi College of Music, Department of Music Composition. Afterwards she began her activities as a composer and arranger while in college, and has been involved in making music for movies, commercials, TV programs, animated features, and ambient music. While in college, she released a symphony entitled "Orasho". Through her masterful manipulation of both orchestras and synthesizers, she has attracted attention from various sectors for creating grandiose, dramatic sounds and beautiful melodies. Her awards include the Mainichi Film Contest Award for Best Music, and the 21st, 24th, 26th, 27th, 29th and 30th Japanese Academy Award for Music, and Jackson Hole Film Festival 2007(USA) Best Composer Award.
Affiliated with [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
__Hiromi Kikuta__ is a Japanese sound director, who works for the company Rakuonsha.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Utsumi is best known for her work with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/), particularly as the original director of [Free!](https://anilist.co/anime/18507/), and for her later work at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/), where she directed [Banana Fish](https://anilist.co/anime/100388/). (Source: Wikipedia)

__[Website](http://kroi.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KroiOfficial) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc9CJVSnJx5WTq8E9T4bIoA)__

__Introduction:__
A five-piece band with a mixed musical style that incorporates influences from all music genres, including R&B, funk, soul, rock, and hip-hop. Formed in Tokyo in February 2018, they debuted with their 1st single "Suck a Lemmon" in October of the same year. In June 2021, they made their major debut with their 1st album "LENS". In addition to music activities, each member engages in a variety of activities such as fashion modeling, design, and song production.

__Members:__
[Leo Uchida](https://anilist.co/staff/324833/Leo-Uchida) (内田怜央) – Vocals, Guitar
Yuki Hasebe (長谷部悠生) – Guitar
Masanori Seki (関将典) – Bass
Daiki Chiba (千葉大樹) – Keyboard
Hidetomo Masuda (益田英知) – Drums
Japanese costume designer. He was nominated for Best Costume Design at the Asian Film Awards for the 2010 samurai action film *13 Assassins*.

[Official Website](https://mahirucoda.com/) | [Profile (Sony Music Artists)](https://www.sma.co.jp/s/sma/artist/327?ima=0000&link=ROBO004#/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mahirucoda/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mahirucoda) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdxuCcds9xCd9vzHKr5cAsw)

Japanese singer-songwriter, jazz pianist, and actor. She debuted as a pianist in 2018 under the name Coda Mahiru a.k.a. Mappy (甲田まひる a.k.a. Mappy) before making her re-debut as a singer-songwriter in 2021. Coda performed the role of Power in the 2023 stage adaptation of [Chainsaw Man](https://anilist.co/manga/105778), *Chainsaw Man The Stage*.

[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCOB1X12CH6XJpgzOXZ2jqMw) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1dZ8IZ8BXP30yhG50TH06o) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/us/artist/ballistik-boyz-from-exile-tribe/1458858934) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ballistik.boyz.official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ballistik_fext/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ballistik_fext)


BALLISTIK BOYZ from EXILE TRIBE are a 7 member J-pop boy group under the talent agency LDH JAPAN. The group was formed on 23rd April 2018 with the idea of making a fusion of the renowned J-pop male group EXILE and the hip-hop male group DOBERMAN INFINITY. A collaboration was held between LDH and EXILE's founder HIRO, and the latter group to determine the lineup. The potential members were selected from the finalists of EXILE Presents VOCAL BATTLE AUDITION 5 and winners of PROJECT TARO. 

After presenting a final group performance at the end of a 10 day survival training camp that proved their ability to work together, the group name BALLISTIK BOYZ was announced on 1st May 2018. This newly assembled hip-hop oriented unit became a part of the collective supergroup EXILE TRIBE that carries EXILE's legacy. Aside from their concept, they're set apart in the umbrella unit for the fact that they're the first ever group among all to have every member participate in vocal activities, whereas the other groups' members have fixed separate roles for singing and/or dancing.

###**Members:**###

**Masahiro Sunada** (vocalist, performer)
**Ryuta Hidaka** (vocalist, performer)
**Miku Fukahori** (vocalist, performer)
**Yoshiyuki Kanou** (vocalist, performer)
**Ryusei Kainuma** (rapper, performer)
**Riki Matsui** (rapper, performer)
**Rikiya Okuda** (rapper, performer)

__[Website](https://dapump.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/DAPUMPJP)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/dapumpjp)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/DAPUMPch)__

__Formed:__ 1996

__Introduction:__
DA PUMP is a Japanese boy band under record label SONIC GROOVE (2011-), having previously been under record label avex tune (1997-2010)

__Members:__
- [Issa Hentona](https://anilist.co/staff/216060) (辺土名一茶) – leader, vocalist, MC (1996-)
- Daichi Kato (加藤大地) – dancer (2008-)
- Tomoki Nakamura (中村朋揮) – dancer (2008-)
- Tomohiro Taniguchi (谷口知広) – MC, dancer(2008-)
- [Kimitaka Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/163044/Kimitaka-Kondou) (近藤公貴) – MC, dancer (2008-)
- YORI – dancer, chorus (2008-)
- Yuuya Tanimoto (谷本裕也) – dancer, MC, chorus (2008-)

__Former Members:__
- Shinobu Miyara (宮良忍) – MC, dancer, chorus (1996-2005)
- Yukinari Tamaki (玉城幸也) – MC, dancer, chorus (1996-2008)
- Ken Okumoto (奥本健) – choreographer, lead MC, dance, chorus (1996-2009)
- Kazuma Yamane (山根和馬) (2008–2013)
